00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 parserImplicitPlane.pl - Implement implicit planes.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 This is a Parser class that implements implicit planes as
00024 a subclass of the Formula class.  The standard ->cmp routine
00025 will work for this, provided we define the compare() function
00026 needed by the overloaded ==.  We assign the special precedence
00027 so that overloaded operations will be promoted to the ones below.
00028 
00029 Use ImplicitPlane(point,vector), ImplicitPlane(point,number) or
00030 ImplicitPlane(formula) to create an ImplicitPlane object.
00031 The first form uses the point as a point on the plane and the
00032 vector as the normal for the plane.  The second form uses the point
00033 as the coefficients of the variables and the number as the value
00034 that the formula must equal.  The third form uses the formula
00035 directly.
00036 
00037 The number of variables in the Context determines the dimension of
00038 the "plane" being defined.  If there are only two, the formula
00039 produces an implicit line, but if there are four variables, it will
00040 be a hyperplane in four-space.  You can specify the variables you
00041 want to use by supplying an additional parameter, which is a
00042 reference to an array of variable names.
00043 
00044 Usage examples:
00045 
00046     $P = ImplicitPlane(Point(1,0,2),Vector(-1,1,3)); #  -x+y+3z = 5
00047     $P = ImplicitPlane([1,0,2],[-1,1,3]);            #  -x+y+3z = 5
00048     $P = ImplicitPlane([1,0,2],4);                   #  x+2z = 4
00049     $P = ImplicitPlane("x+2y-z=5");
00050 
00051     Context()->variables->are(x=>'Real',y=>'Real',z=>'Real',w=>'Real');
00052     $P = ImplicitPlane([1,0,2,-1],10);               # w+2y-z = 10 (alphabetical order)
00053     $P = ImplicitPlane([3,-1,2,4],5,['x','y','z','w']);  # 3x-y+2z+4w = 5
00054     $P = ImplicitPlane([3,-1,2],5,['y','z','w']);  # 3y-z+2w = 5
00055 
00056 Then use
00057 
00058     ANS($P->cmp);
00059 
00060 to get the answer checker for $P.
00061 
00062 =cut
00063 
00064 loadMacros('MathObjects.pl');
00065 
00066 sub _parserImplicitPlane_init {ImplicitPlane::Init()}; # don't reload this file
00067 
00068 ##################################################
00069 #
00070 #  Define the subclass of Formula
00071 #
00072 package ImplicitPlane;
00073 our @ISA = qw(Value::Formula);
00074 
00075 sub Init {
00076   my $context = $main::context{ImplicitPlane} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Vector");
00077   $context->{name} = "ImplicitPlane";
00078   $context->{precedence}{ImplicitPlane} = $context->{precedence}{special};
00079   #$context->{value}{Equality} = "ImplicitPlane::equality";
00080   Parser::BOP::equality->Allow($context);
00081   $context->operators->set('=' => {class => 'ImplicitPlane::equality'});
00082 
00083   main::Context("ImplicitPlane");  ### FIXME:  probably should require authors to set this explicitly
00084 
00085   main::PG_restricted_eval('sub ImplicitPlane {ImplicitPlane->new(@_)}');
00086 }
00087 
00088 sub new {
00089   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00090   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00091   return shift if scalar(@_) == 1 && ref($_[0]) eq 'ImplicitPlane';
00092   $_[0] = $context->Package("Point")->new($context,$_[0]) if ref($_[0]) eq 'ARRAY';
00093   $_[1] = $context->Package("Vector")->new($context,$_[1]) if ref($_[1]) eq 'ARRAY';
00094 
00095   my ($p,$N,$plane,$vars,$d,$type); $type = 'plane';
00096   if (scalar(@_) >= 2 && Value::classMatch($_[0],'Point','Vector') &&
00097       Value::classMatch($_[1],'Vector') || Value::isRealNumber($_[1])) {
00098     #
00099     # Make a plane from a point and a vector,
00100     # or from a list of coefficients and the constant
00101     #
00102     $p = shift; $N = shift;
00103     if (Value::classMatch($N,'Vector')) {
00104       $d = $p.$N;
00105     } else {
00106       $d = $context->Package("Real")->make($context,$N);
00107       $N = $context->Package("Vector")->new($context,$p);
00108     }
00109     $vars = shift || [$context->variables->names];
00110     $vars = [$vars] unless ref($vars) eq 'ARRAY';
00111     $type = 'line' if scalar(@{$vars}) == 2;
00112     my @terms = (); my $i = 0;
00113     foreach my $x (@{$vars}) {push @terms, $N->{data}[$i++]->string.$x}
00114     $plane = $context->Package("Formula")->new(join(' + ',@terms).' = '.$d->string)->reduce(@_);
00115   } else {
00116     $formula = $context->Package("Formula");
00117     #
00118     #  Determine the normal vector and d value from the equation
00119     #
00120     $plane = shift;
00121     $plane = $formula->new($context,$plane) unless Value::isValue($plane);
00122     $vars = shift || [$context->variables->names];
00123     $vars = [$vars] unless ref($vars) eq 'ARRAY';
00124     $type = 'line' if scalar(@{$vars}) == 2;
00125     Value::Error("Your formula doesn't look like an implicit %s",$type)
00126       unless $plane->type eq 'Equality';
00127     #
00128     #  Find the coefficients of the formula
00129     #
00130     my $f = ($formula->new($context,$plane->{tree}{lop}) -
00131          $formula->new($context,$plane->{tree}{rop}))->reduce;
00132     my $F = $f->perlFunction(undef,[@{$vars}]);
00133     my @v = split('','0' x scalar(@{$vars}));
00134     $d = -&$F(@v); my @coeff = (@v);
00135     foreach my $i (0..scalar(@v)-1)
00136       {$v[$i] = 1; $coeff[$i] = &$F(@v) + $d; $v[$i] = 0}
00137     #
00138     #  Check that the student's formula really is what we thought
00139     #
00140     $N = Value::Vector->new([@coeff]);
00141     $plane = ImplicitPlane->new($N,$d,$vars,'-x=-y'=>0,'-x=n'=>0);
00142     Value::Error("Your formula isn't a linear one")
00143       unless ($formula->new($plane->{tree}{lop}) -
00144               $formula->new($plane->{tree}{rop})) == $f;
00145     $plane = $plane->reduce;
00146   }
00147   Value::Error("The equation of a %s must be non-zero somewhere",$type)
00148     if ($N->norm == 0);
00149   $plane->{d} = $d; $plane->{N} = $N; $plane->{implicit} = $type;
00150   return bless $plane, $class;
00151 }
00152 
00153 #
00154 #  We already know the vectors are non-zero, so check
00155 #  if the equations are multiples of each other.
00156 #
00157 sub compare {
00158   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrder(@_);
00159   $r = new ImplicitPlane($r);# if ref($r) ne ref($self);
00160   my ($lN,$ld) = ($l->{N},$l->{d});
00161   my ($rN,$rd) = ($r->{N},$r->{d});
00162   if ($rd == 0 || $ld == 0) {
00163     return $rd <=> $ld unless $ld == $rd;
00164     return $lN <=> $rN unless (areParallel $lN $rN);
00165     return 0;
00166   }
00167   return $rd*$lN <=> $ld*$rN;
00168 }
00169 
00170 sub cmp_class {'an Implicit '.(shift->{implicit})};
00171 sub showClass {shift->cmp_class};
00172 
00173 sub cmp_defaults{(
00174   Value::Real::cmp_defaults(shift),
00175   ignoreInfinity => 0,    # report infinity as an error
00176 )}
00177 
00178 #
00179 #  Only compare two equalities
00180 #
00181 sub typeMatch {
00182   my $self = shift; my $other = shift; my $ans = shift;
00183   return ref($other) && $other->type eq 'Equality' unless ref($self);
00184   return ref($other) && $self->type eq $other->type;
00185 }
00186 
00187 #
00188 #  We subclass BOP::equality so that we can give a warning about
00189 #  things like 1 = 3
00190 #
00191 package ImplicitPlane::equality;
00192 our @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP::equality);
00193 
00194 sub _check {
00195   my $self = shift;
00196   $self->SUPER::_check;
00197   $self->Error("An implicit equation can't be constant on both sides")
00198     if $self->{lop}{isConstant} && $self->{rop}{isConstant};
00199 }
